nl.helixsoft.stats

Interface DataFrame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataFrame, ColumnBoundDataFrame, DefaultDataFrame, MatrixDataFrame

    public interface DataFrame
    A table of data, ready for statistical operations.

    All data is kept in memory

    Each column can have headers

    Each column is of a single type.

    Implementations may use native type arrays (double[] or int[]) for efficiency.

    There are facilities for statistical functions and plotting.

    Some operations modify the data frame in-place. These methods typically return "this" to allow chaining operations.

    Operations like cut() ... return a copy of the DataFrame object. NOTE: implementing both TableModel and Iterable turned out not to be so hot because groovy inserts its own iterator() method in TableModels. Currently implementing neither. If you want a Iterable, see @link{DataFrame.asRecordIterable} If you want a TableModel, use DataFrameOperation.asTableModel (df, editable)

      • select

        DataFrame select(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rowIdx)
        Extract specified rows by index. The input list may contain duplicate values, may re-order values, or may contain null values. returns a new DataFrame object.

      • merge

        DataFrame merge(DataFrame that,
              int onThisColumn,
              int onThatColumn)
        Deprecated. : use DataFrameOperation instead
        Performs a merge (a.k.a. JOIN in SQL terms) with another table. returns a new DataFrame object. This is a FULL JOIN - Rows where the primary key doesn't exists in either this or the other, are filled with null values.
